Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.handler

Interface RequestHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
HandlerAdapter
public interface RequestHandler
Handles requests about the possibilities of a player during his turn, based on the rules of the game. This is the only interface the user can have on the whole handling of the game rules, thus allowing a strong decoupling between the "game logic" and the "rules logic".

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkForWin​(Coord after, ActionType at)
    Returns true when the last performed action caused the player to win
    void generate​(Coord after, ActionType at)
    Updates the rules of the handler with the rules to be used for the next action.
    void getValidSpaces​(Coord current, Board board, java.util.List<Coord> movableSpaces, java.util.Map<Level,​java.util.List<Coord>> buildableSpaces, java.util.Map<Coord,​Coord> forces)
    Populates the collections passed by the caller with data about what actions can be performed and what actions can't
    void reset()
    Resets the rules of this handler to its initial rules.

  • Method Details

    • getValidSpaces

      void getValidSpaces​(Coord current, Board board, java.util.List<Coord> movableSpaces, java.util.Map<Level,​java.util.List<Coord>> buildableSpaces, java.util.Map<Coord,​Coord> forces)
      Populates the collections passed by the caller with data about what actions can be performed and what actions can't
      Parameters:
      current - the position of the current worker, i.e. the worker that will perform the action
      board - the board to evaluate for all possible actions
      movableSpaces - the list in which the coordinates reachable by a move will be put
      buildableSpaces - the map in which the coordinates where a build (for each level) can be performed will be put
      forces - the map in which the "force" destination will be put, for each space that requires a forcing in order to move there.

    • generate

      void generate​(Coord after, ActionType at)
      Updates the rules of the handler with the rules to be used for the next action.
      Parameters:
      after - the target position of the last performed action
      at - the ActionType of the last performed action

    • checkForWin

      boolean checkForWin​(Coord after, ActionType at)
      Returns true when the last performed action caused the player to win
      Parameters:
      after - the target position of the last performed action
      at - the ActionType of the last performed action
      Returns:
      true when the last performed action caused the player to win

    • reset

      void reset()
      Resets the rules of this handler to its initial rules. When ending a turn (i.e. a sequence of actions) the initial rules must be restored, in order to be used for the next turn. Thus this method has to be called when the corresponding player's turn ends.
